reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: I was very impressed with all the features packed into these switches. Weather, clock, multiple choices for display (analogue or digital clock, on-screen display of light on/off status, etc), Matter or WiFi communications, dimming or non-dimming, intercom to one switch or voice broadcast to all, default ‚Äúon‚Äù levels (75% brightness for example), microphone on/off, vacation mode, scenes‚Ä¶ impressive and very high tech looking. I don‚Äôt have 2 in the same house so I haven‚Äôt tested voice quality of the intercom features. I put one in a home I‚Äôm selling so it would turn the porch lights on at night & off at sunrise. I went to the house this weekend and it was locked up, displaying ‚ÄúHomeAI‚Äù and nothing else. I couldn‚Äôt turn on the light locally by the push button and the touch screen was frozen, but it still worked via the app. I tripped the breaker for a minute and it revived again. I hope it continues working! The one thing I wish you could do (and could be done with a firmware upgrade) is have the switch stay on whatever screen you wanted it left on. One switch could be an intercom, one could have the digital slider for dimming, one could display weather, one switch could always display the ‚ÄúScenes‚Äù buttons to control groups of lights, etc‚Ä¶ but currently they all default back to the same screen after 15 seconds or so and you have to scroll to your preferred screen. Price is very reasonable for what you get. One ‚Äúgotcha‚Äù to be aware of. Although it supports the universal Matter protocol, it cannot control any other Matter switches except the ORVIBO ones.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2024
reviews.title: Feature rich, very nice looking.

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required

It can be controlled from Google Home just fine, but the whole point of getting it for me was as a scene switch with a flexible display. And that it doesn't do.

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: First of all, I would like to say that I am very well versed in smart home technology and have been an early adopter since Alexa came on the scene. I have integrated light switches, outlets, doorbells, cameras, major appliances, robot vacuums, all forms of motion and tracking sensors, air purifiers, showers, faucets, and even electric doors into my home. I have been able to troubleshoot most any problem from integrating a new piece of technology into my home or office environment. But I have given up on ORVIBO and Mixpad 1. I have spent hours trying to get 8 of these light switches connected to their app and then introduced into my Google Home environment. The first step of getting these devices connected to their own app has proven to be an exceptionally exhausting fail. After connecting one device rather quickly, the remaining 7 won't connect to the app. I get repeated failure messages from their QR codes on each device, try the discovery option as well as the manual addition option. Nothing will get these remaining 7 to connect. The only reason why I gave these devices 2 stars instead of 1 is because I was finally able to connect all directly to Google Home via the Matter protocol. No such luck via Samsung Smartthings or the Orvibo app but at least they are now on my smarthome network directly via Google Home. However, that means most of their nifty functions are completely unusable since I need them connected to the Orvibo app for the broadcasting or other features. If I was able to redo then I would not have wasted my money on these great looking and well-marketed devices. Something is seriously wrong with their SW and discovery process. I wish I could get those hours back of my life that were nothing but excessive frustration with no positive outcome.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
reviews.title: I really wanted to like these - but regret purchase

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: This switch (mixpad d1) with the iPhone app isn‚Äôt ready for any use other than a switch. It‚Äôs matter capable but can ONLY control its own ORVIBO devices. It cannot handle anything setup in your matter system. It cannot make a scene with your other matter devices. Worst is in the display options on the switch - you can turn on a single button at the bottom of the display - but it can‚Äôt be customized or changed to something else (like a scene or automation) - it‚Äôs only function can be to turn the switch on. This is INSANE since there is a physical switch right below it. Who needs a digital representation of the physical button????? The app further doesn‚Äôt allow ANY customization of the switch. You can only do that on the switch itself. With some software updates this switch could be great as it sets up easily, has a great display and with matter could be a great controller. As it stands now it is the world‚Äôs prettiest barely connected smart switch.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2024
reviews.title: Half Baked - not ready for a true smart home

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: This is probably the most technically advanced switch I've found. I used it to replace some older technology Insteon switches. This was much better. The things I loved are. 1. That the switch displays device names that make sense and you can easily change it. With the older tech I was using, you had to buy custom engraved keys or use clear keycaps with a label under it. 2. I like that it has a button on the bottom that can be used to turn the main light on or off. 3. You can add control of any other Orvibo switch or Orvibo app scene to the switch. 4. On the main page (screen), you can personalize the page to display several different options that include combinations of the weather, date, time, and main switch button. 5. It supports Matter, but not until it does a firmware update on those I received. What are the main things I didn't like? 1. For installations where you have in a multi-gang box with multi-gang switch plate, the Decora cutout required needs to be larger for this. If there is a brand that fits properly, I'd sure like to know what it is. What this means is you have to file the openings of the plate to properly fit the switch. This can take quite a bit of time to do it properly. For single gang, the switch comes with it's own screwless plate. 2. Response can be a little slow ... noticeably. I have a mix of Matter over WiFi and Matter over Thread switches and I do not have this issue with Matter over Thread ... so perhaps they need to consider moving to that. 3. I've had an issue where some of the switch loose their WiFi connection ... like right now out of 10 switches, two are showing "No Response" in the HomeKit app. My router supports a separate IOT network and all of my smart devices are connected to it. So far, the only way to get these switches to reconnect is to either reboot the router or go to the WiFi setup on the switch and turn the WiFi off and then back on. Whenever I have the "No Response" error showing in HomeKit, the switch will not respond to Siri commands or via HomeKit on an iPhone. In my experience, Thread just seems more reliable ... so again a Thread version would be great. 4. Lastly, they talk about how to wire the switch for 3-way and basically one switch operates as a 1 way switch connected to the load and the other is simply a remote connected to a hot wire and white wire with the load wire capped off. The issue is there is no way of programming or linking the two switches so the the switch on the bottom of the remote will toggle the main light on/off. In addition, there is a button that appears on the screens that controls power to the load that is not connected to anything. Technical support responded ... and I get there is was a way of hiding that button prior to the Matter firmware upgrade, but it seems no matter what I tried I could not hide it with the Matter firmware. The idea of showing a button on the screen that has no purpose makes this switch unusable as a 3-way in my mind. My old home automation did the same thing, but you could pair the remote switch to give the same appearance as a 3-way. But overall, I really love how this switch looks and the design. I really am not interested in intercom or broadcast modes to didn't test those.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.title: Fantastic ... but could be better.

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: The main reason I purchased the switch was to use as a scene selector. I have a 4 button scene selector that works flawlessly but I wanted a touch screen that I could add buttons to and also see the weather on the way out. The weather display works great and the main light turns on and off with Siri and the Home App. Setup in the Home App with Matter support was easy. Problem is you can‚Äôt program any scenes for the switch to display from the Home App and I haven‚Äôt seen a way for the ORVIBO app to access HomeKit data so that you can create automations and scenes there. Emailed support and haven‚Äôt received a reply. It appears the switch isn‚Äôt 100% HomeKit compatible, just what you hardwire to the switch, no scenes for Apple user.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2023
reviews.title: No Real HomeKit support

It also has its own app but I prefer the Alexa as most of my smart devices run on that. Easier than buying smart bulbs for the chandelier (it takes 12 bulbs). Also this has a longer lifespan than a smart bulb. Overall very happy with this product.

reviews.title: Made my dumb switch smart

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: This smart touchscreen dimmer switch is a cutting-edge addition to any smart home setup. Operating on a 2.4GHz WiFi network (not 5GHz), this dimmer light switch offers seamless integration with Home Talk, Alexa, and Google Home, allowing for convenient voice control. The smart touchscreen interface provides an intuitive and user-friendly way to adjust your lighting to your preferred level. The timer and schedule function adds another layer of convenience, allowing you to automate your lighting based on your daily routines. The switch requires a neutral wire for installation and is designed for single pole use. This might require some basic electrical knowledge for installation, but once set up, it offers a sleek and modern aesthetic to any room. Not really much different than installing many standard light switches.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.title: Works well with Google Home

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: ***A NEUTRAL WIRE IS REQUIRED FOR INSTALLATION*** thought I would start with that since its important. Next, this switch looks amazing in the wall. The display is really a unique thing, super clear, and super bright. There is a button right below the screen to turn the light on and off or you can do it from the touch screen. All the features in the switches menu system work perfect. You have a few options to set the switches home screen plus a host of options for how you want the switch to work. You can set times, modes, hours of operation plus the app gives you even more options and remote access. The installations was easy. As soon as you apply power to the switch it's in its setup mode and that takes a few minutes, and you are all good to go. The app works well, and Alexa control worked perfect.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2023
reviews.title: Love this Touchscreen Dimmer Switch!!!!

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: I have two of these connected to dimmable lights in my home. They work great and will definitely be buying more if these continue to last. They're only slightly more expensive than the Z-wave GE/Enbrighten switches I have installed throughout the rest of the house. The only gripe I have is that they are not Smartthings compatible, or at least I was not able to connect them to smartthings. This means I cannot just use smartthings to control everything in my house, I have to go to Alexa to change these light settings. They do respond perfectly to Alexa voice commands so its not really a big deal, but I would have loved to be able to control them via a web interface like I can my other smartthings compatible products.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2023
reviews.title: Cool little screen at a great price, not Smartthings compatible?

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: It does all that I was expecting. Displays the current weather and temp in F. Shows digital or analog time along with the weather. The diming is easy and fluid. My only small issue is understanding the device's App software.... it can be trying at times. Thank goodness for Alexa.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2023
reviews.title: A Straight Forward, Easy to Use Dimmer Switch

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: Cannot get their app to connect to other devices (ones that work on Tuya & Smart life). Cannot get Smart Life/Tuya to connect to it, thus I cannot add other switches for it to control. Perhaps the manufacturer can help out with this as I'm trying to get a Moe's dimmer module to pair with it (I'll change my review).
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2023
reviews.title: Not compatible with other smart devices!

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: If I could afford to have one of these in every room in the house, I definitely would! These are an awesome and small form factor addition to our smart home.. the touchscreen light control was very easy to configure (we use Tuya and Amazon devices, and this synced with those perfectly). The controls on the screen are ultra responsive and bright enough to see even in a well lit room. Configuration was straightforward -- though I'm still working my way through the learning curve on what all capabilities this switch has. I'd love to see integrated control of Amazon's music service as that's becoming very widespread. Other than that, this is an excellent addition and integration to our automated home.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2023
reviews.title: Make Automation Great Again!

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: This is a really good smart switch. Operation is simple, install was no more difficult than any other light switch, and it looks pretty cool.

reviews.title: Good switxh

reviews.productTitle: ORVIBO Matter Smart Dimmer Switch, Works with Apple Home, Alexa & Google Home, w/Weather Display, Energy Monitoring, Single Pole, Neutral Wire Required
reviews.text: I chose this smart dimmer mostly for the ability to control it by voice commands with my Alexa Show devices, and it works great! The unit is very compact for its capabilities and easily works in a single gang box. It was simple to install and relatively easy to integrate it with my existing Alexa devices! I really like the responsiveness of the touchscreen and the color and brightness are also very good. The unit connects to WiFi which enables the Alexa control as well as other features including time, basic weather, and intercom to other similar devices from the same manufacturer. I also like that it can be programmed for different timer, schedule, or automated modes like ‚Äúvacation‚Äù for example. Overall, this is an awesome high quality device and works well with my Alexa system, so it earns top marks from me!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2023
reviews.title: Awesome touchscreen dimmer packed with features and works with Alexa!
